Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Put the isync where it's supposed to be.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tighten up register usage for inline PPC version of tas().

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some signed-vs-unsigned-int issuesSEMICOLON make print_aligned_vertical safe for zero-column tables.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Handle cp, rm, and exec for Win32.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Win32 path handling for / vs. BACKSLASH and drive letters.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix compile problem with Win32 macro used inside another macro.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clarify exactly when DST-changeover-induced regression test failures can be expected to occur.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix markup.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Generate pg_config.h.in by autoheader. Separate out manually editable parts. Standardize spelling of comments in pg_config.h.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: General editing

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove unnecessary dt2local() call.

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Avoid primary key lookup (and lock) if foreign key does not change on UPDATE. This get's rid of the long standing annoyance that updating a row that has foreign keys locks all the referenced rows even if the foreign key values do not change. The trick is to actually do a check identical to NO ACTION after an eventually done UPDATE in the SET DEFAULT case. Since a SET DEFAULT operation should have moved referencing rows to a new "home", a following NO ACTION check can only fail if the column defaults of the referencing table resulted in the key we actually deleted. Thanks to Stephan. Jan

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Added some more informix compatibility functions.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove extraneous semicolons.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Mark TimeScales constants as double to avoid integer overflow in some compilers.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Get rid of inappropriate flags in CPPFLAGS override --- these break non-gcc compilers, and they would never belong in CPPFLAGS anyway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Get rid of inappropriate flags in CPPFLAGS override --- these break non-gcc compilers, and they would never belong in CPPFLAGS anyway.

Document.document: Get rid of inappropriate flags in CPPFLAGS override --- these break non-gcc compilers, and they would never belong in CPPFLAGS anyway.

Document.document: Get rid of inappropriate flags in CPPFLAGS override --- these break non-gcc compilers, and they would never belong in CPPFLAGS anyway.

Document.author: davec
Document.document: added addDataType to the interface

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: First phase of work on array improvements. ARRAY[x,y,z] constructor expressions, ARRAY(sub-SELECT) expressions, some array functions. Polymorphic functions using ANYARRAY/ANYELEMENT argument and return types. Some regression tests in place, documentation is lacking. Joe Conway, with some kibitzing from Tom Lane.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: In an effort to reduce the total number of chapters, combine the small chapters on extending types, operators, and aggregates into the extending functions chapter. Move the information on how to call table functions into the queries chapter. Remove some outdated information that is already present in a better form in other parts of the documentation.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove premature attempt to constant-fold type coercion expressions. While usually safe, this fails if the coercion function needs the query snapshot to be set already. Per example from Nigel Andrews.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove premature attempt to constant-fold type coercion expressions. While usually safe, this fails if the coercion function needs the query snapshot to be set already. Per example from Nigel Andrews.

Document.document: Informix fixes.

Document.document: Fix error recovery for SSL_read/SSL_write calls.

Document.document: Integrate the operator class section into the comprehensive extending SQL chapter as well.

Document.document: exposed the addDataType method to the PGConnection, allows users to add datatypes

Document.document: Clarify description of our deviation from standard for temp tables, per suggestion from Mike Sykes.

Document.document: Minor copy-editing.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Document file name as optional for BACKSLASHo in psql help (BACKSLASHh).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Reorganize clog's error reporting so that PANIC on clog I/O error can be reduced to a plain ERROR. Should make it at least a little less painful to deal with data-corruption problems.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Another try at correctly explaining the difference between Postgres and SQL92 temp tables. Possibly I got it right this time.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: path.c needs to be included in libpqSEMICOLON per Joe Conway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: eqjoinsel's logic for case where MCV lists are not present should account for NULLsSEMICOLON in hindsight this is obvious since the code for the MCV-lists case would reduce to this when there are zero entries in both lists. Per example from Alec Mitchell.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: eqjoinsel's logic for case where MCV lists are not present should account for NULLsSEMICOLON in hindsight this is obvious since the code for the MCV-lists case would reduce to this when there are zero entries in both lists. Per example from Alec Mitchell.

Document.document: Add better markup and improve some text here and there.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Bring SQL ref pages to consistent format, part 1.

Document.document: Change names of ISO-8859-x encodings to ISO_8859_x, to match reality.

Document.document: Update Japanese FAQ, from Jun Kuwamura.

Document.document: First draft of revised FE/BE protocol specification. Still needs work, but I'm putting it up so people can see and comment on it.

Document.document: Fix stupid oversight ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix stupid oversight ...

Document.document: Fix some problems exposed by building outside the source tree.

Document.document: Add mention of OpenProjects IRC channel. It is as large as EFNet now.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Various clarificationsSEMICOLON add a clear DRAFT markerSEMICOLON minor adjustments in some message types. In particular add text/binary flag to StartCopyIn and StartCopyOut, so that client library can know what is expected or forthcoming.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Applied patches from Kris Jurka fixing a string tokenizing problem and fixing an order by problem for index metadata results. Also includes removing some unused code as well as a fix to the toString method on statement. Modified Files: Tag: REL7_3_STABLE jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc1/AbstractJdbc1DatabaseMetaData.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc1/AbstractJdbc1Statement.java

Also includes removing some unused code as well as a fix to the toString method on statement. Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix abstime-to-time cast function, which has had broken implementation since 7.2, per bug #947. Turns out it had wrong volatility label, too. Can't force initdb in 7.3 branch, but fix anyway for future installs.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix abstime-to-time cast function, which has had broken implementation since 7.2, per bug #947. Turns out it had wrong volatility label, too. Can't force initdb in 7.3 branch, but fix anyway for future installs.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make pg_dump's concurency capability more prominent.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: First phase of FE/BE protocol modifications: new StartupPacket layout with variable-width fields. No more truncation of long user names. Also, libpq can now send its environment-variable-driven SET commands as part of the startup packet, saving round trips to server.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make Win32 tests to match existing Cygwin tests, where appropriate.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix breakage from recent variable-handling changes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Second round of FE/BE protocol changes. Frontend->backend messages now have length counts, and COPY IN data is packetized into messages.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add more documentation about shared memory costs.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add pipe parameter to COPY function to allow proper line termination.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow BACKSLASHr and BACKSLASHrBACKSLASHn termination for COPY files. Output BACKSLASHrBACKSLASHn termination on Win32. Disallow literal carriage return as a data value, backslash-carriage-return and BACKSLASHr still allowed. Doc changes already committed.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make it clear it is the server version that determines if crlf is used. Idea from Joe Conway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Avoid O(N^2) behavior with lots of deferred triggers by making deferredTriggerInvokeEvents only scan events added since it last ran. Stephan Szabo, some corrections by Tom Lane.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix char-vs-pg_wchar confusion in p_ere(), per failure report from Tom O'Dowd. This fix is not relevant to CVS tip anymore, but we should fix it in 7.3.*.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix multiple causes of breakage in plperl's error handling.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Apple's assembler likes the inlined TAS syntax too, so no reason to maintain a separate out-of-line version of PPC tas() anymore. Also fix S_UNLOCK for __powerpc64__ platforms.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: stddev() and variance() should return NULL when there is just one input value, per recent discussion on pgsql-general.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add mention of Novell Netware 6 port.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Prevent palloc(0) error when parent table has zero columns.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Prevent palloc(0) error when parent table has zero columns.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Another round of protocol changes. Backend-to-frontend messages now all have length words. COPY OUT reimplemented per new protocol: it doesn't need BACKSLASH. anymore, thank goodness. COPY BINARY to/from frontend works, at least as far as the backend is concerned --- libpq's PQgetline API is not up to snuff, and will have to be replaced with something that is null-safe. libpq uses message length words for performance improvement (no cycles wasted rescanning long messages), but not yet for error recovery.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Win32 versions of unlink and rename --- loop until success.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Win32 unlink/rename file.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add dirmod to libpq Makefile.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: getaddrinfo has no business doing unlink().

Document.author: petere
Document.document: More editing of reference pages.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update CVS with new FAQ.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove Win32 special rename/unlink from libpq.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix misbehavior of replace() on strings containing '%'. Will patch separately but equivalently in HEAD.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix misbehavior of func_error() on type names containing '%'. Will patch separately but equivalently in HEAD.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add PQunescapeBytea() and PQfeeMem() to the Win32 DLL list. Karl Waclawek

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add comments to replace/unlink Win32 functions.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add shared memory and semaphore routines for Win32.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add shared memory and semaphore routines for Win32. Also update copyright to be ours, with approval from Jan.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: pgindent new Win32 files.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Infrastructure for upgraded error reporting mechanism. elog.c is rewritten and the protocol is changed, but most elog calls are still elog calls. Also, we need to contemplate mechanisms for controlling all this functionality --- eg, how much stuff should appear in the postmaster log? And what API should libpq expose for it?

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Win32 shmem/sema prototypes.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: No need for include for Win32 right now.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Win32 Makefile for IPC stuff.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adjust subquery qual pushdown rules so that we can push down a qual into a UNION that has some type coercions applied to the component queries, so long as the qual itself does not reference any columns that have such coercions. Per example from Jonathan Bartlett 24-Apr-03.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Use closesocket() for all socket/pipe closing, because Win32 requires it, and map that to close() on Unix.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: COPY and pg_dump failed to cope with zero-column tables. Fix 'em.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix breakage induced by yours truly in Kerberos and PAM code.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: const-ify info_cb() to match recent openssl releases. Per Joe Conway.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix typo in DLL list.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add new versions DLL lists, from Karl Waclawek

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Prevent unlink/rename Win32 mapping on frontends.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: In the continuing saga of FE/BE protocol revisions, add reporting of initial values and runtime changes in selected parameters. This gets rid of the need for an initial 'select pg_client_encoding()' query in libpq, bringing us back to one message transmitted in each direction for a standard connection startup. To allow server version to be sent using the same GUC mechanism that handles other parameters, invent the concept of a never-settable GUC parameter: you can 'show server_version' but it's not settable by any GUC input source. Create 'lc_collate' and 'lc_ctype' never-settable parameters so that people can find out these settings without need for pg_controldata. (These side ideas were all discussed some time ago in pgsql-hackers, but not yet implemented.)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make [VACUUM] ANALYZE safe on zero-column tables.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make [VACUUM] ANALYZE safe on zero-column tables.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch fixes for zero-column tables in COPY, pg_dump.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak stats collector start logic so that we will not try to spawn a new stats collector oftener than once a minute. Per gripe from Erik Walthinsen 4/25/03.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Correct oversight in createlang: test for pre-existing handler function was broken by opaque->language_handler change. I see this is already fixed in CVS tip, but must back-patch for 7.3.3.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add transaction status field to ReadyForQuery messages, and make room for tableID/columnID in RowDescription. (The latter isn't really implemented yet though --- the backend always sends zeroes, and libpq just throws away the data.)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair permissions problem in RI triggers: query parsing has to be done as the correct user, not only query execution. Per report from Sean Chittenden.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair permissions problem in RI triggers: query parsing has to be done as the correct user, not only query execution. Per report from Sean Chittenden.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Editing of more reference pages.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up some problems in SetClientEncoding: failed to honor doit flag in all cases, leaked TopMemoryContext memory in others. Make the interaction between SetClientEncoding and InitializeClientEncoding cleaner and better documented. I suspect these changes should be back-patched into 7.3, but will wait on Tatsuo's verification.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Department of second thoughts: probably still need an IsTransactionState test in there...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Put back encoding-conversion step in processing of incoming queriesSEMICOLON I had inadvertently omitted it while rearranging things to support length-counted incoming messages. Also, change the parser's API back to accepting a 'char *' query string instead of 'StringInfo', as the latter wasn't buying us anything except overhead. (I think when I put it in I had some notion of making the parser API 8-bit-clean, but seeing that flex depends on null-terminated input, that's not really ever gonna happen.)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix plpgsql so that variables of composite types (rowtypes) can be declared without having to write %ROWTYPE. If the declared type of a variable is a composite type, it'll be taken to be a row variable automatically.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Prevent coredump in current_schemas() if someone has just deleted a schema that was in our search path.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make getaddrinfo's behavior with NULL node parameter agree with the Linux man page for it. This error was preventing CVS tip from accepting remote connections.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Okay, I've had it with PQsetdbLogin having slightly different defaults than PQconnectdb. Reimplement the former to use the same code as the latter. Fix documentation omissions while at it.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Missed some corner cases (PGSERVICE mostly)...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Minor improvement in wording.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Minor wordsmithing on .pgpass description.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update German FAQ, from Ian Barwick

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Code review for holdable-cursors patch. Fix error recovery, memory context sloppiness, some other things. Includes Neil's mopup patch of 22-Apr.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove unneeded define.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Infrastructure for deducing Param types from context, in the same way that the types of untyped string-literal constants are deduced (ie, when coerce_type is applied to 'em, that's what the type must be). Remove the ancient hack of storing the input Param-types array as a global variable, and put the info into ParseState instead. This touches a lot of files because of adjustment of routine parameter lists, but it's really not a large patch. Note: PREPARE statement still insists on exact specification of parameter types, but that could easily be relaxed now, if we wanted to do so.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update to describe new set of globally-known contexts planned for support of extended query features in new FE/BE protocol. TransactionCommandContext is gone (PortalContext replaces it for some purposes), and QueryContext has taken on a new meaning (MessageContext plays its old role).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Documentation refers to box() function where it should say box_intersect(). Thanks to Wes Sheldah for finding this one.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Added an option to force ecpg to also parse files includes via '#include' and some more Informix stuff.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed double definition of ecpg_compat_mode.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair sloppiness about where cached mergeclause pathkeys are allocated. Without this fix, CVS tip dumps core when running the regression tests with geqo_threshold = 2. I would think that a similar patch might be needed in 7.3, but cannot duplicate the failure in that branch --- so for now, leave well enough alone.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Portal and memory management infrastructure for extended query protocol. Both plannable queries and utility commands are now always executed within Portals, which have been revamped so that they can handle the load (they used to be good only for single SELECT queries). Restructure code to push command-completion-tag selection logic out of postgres.c, so that it won't have to be duplicated between simple and extended queries. initdb forced due to addition of a field to Query nodes.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Dump/read non-default GUC values for use by exec'ed backends, for Win32.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out last commit --- wrong patch.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out second part of patch.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: SECOND ATTEMPT Dump/read non-default GUC values for use by exec'ed backend, for Win32.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Handle clog structure in shared memory in exec() case, for Win32.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Cleanup patch for exec() handling.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Patch to fix up LONGVARBINARY support submitted by Amit Gollapudi (agollapudi@demandsolutions.com). Also applied the RefCursor support patch by Nic Ferrier. This patch allows you too return a get a result set from a function that returns a refcursor. For example: call.registerOutParameter(1, Types.OTHER)SEMICOLON call.execute()SEMICOLON ResultSet rs = (ResultSet) call.getObject(1)SEMICOLON Modified Files: jdbc/org/postgresql/core/BaseStatement.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc1/AbstractJdbc1ResultSet.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc1/AbstractJdbc1Statement.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc1/Jdbc1CallableStatement.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc1/Jdbc1PreparedStatement.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc1/Jdbc1Statement.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc2/AbstractJdbc2ResultSet.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc2/Jdbc2CallableStatement.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc2/Jdbc2PreparedStatement.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc2/Jdbc2Statement.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc3/Jdbc3CallableStatement.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc3/Jdbc3PreparedStatement.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc3/Jdbc3Statement.java Added Files: jdbc/org/postgresql/PGRefCursorResultSet.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc1/Jdbc1RefCursorResultSet.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc2/Jdbc2RefCursorResultSet.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc3/Jdbc3RefCursorResultSet.java jdbc/org/postgresql/test/jdbc2/RefCursorTest.java

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix erroneous space calculation leading to core dump in dumpProcLangs, per report from Olivier Prenant. Also fix off-by-one space calculation in ReadTocSEMICOLON this woould not have hurt us until we had more than 100 dependencies for a single object, but wrong is wrong.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix erroneous space calculation leading to core dump in dumpProcLangs, per report from Olivier Prenant. Also fix off-by-one space calculation in ReadTocSEMICOLON this woould not have hurt us until we had more than 100 dependencies for a single object, but wrong is wrong.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: When a TIMESTAMP, TIME, or INTERVAL precision is specified larger than our implementation limits, do not issue an ERRORSEMICOLON instead issue a NOTICE and use the max supported value. Per pgsql-general discussion of 28-Apr, this is needed to allow easy porting from pre-7.3 releases where the limits were higher. Unrelated change in same area: accept GLOBAL TEMP/TEMPORARY as a synonym for TEMPORARY, as per pgsql-hackers discussion of 15-Apr. We previously rejected it, but that was based on a misreading of the spec --- SQL92's GLOBAL temp tables are really closer to what we have than their LOCAL ones.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Last round of reference page editing.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Allow 60 in seconds fields of timestamp, time, interval input values. Per recent discussion on pgsql-general, this is appropriate for spec compliance, and has the nice side-effect of easing porting from old pg_dump files that exhibit the 59.999=>60.000 roundoff problem.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Allow 60 in seconds fields of timestamp, time, interval input values. Per recent discussion on pgsql-general, this is appropriate for spec compliance, and has the nice side-effect of easing porting from old pg_dump files that exhibit the 59.999=>60.000 roundoff problem.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Disable alternate locations on Win32 because it doesn't support symlinks.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Minor improvement in wording.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: In the continuing saga of FE/BE protocol revisions, add reporting of initial values and runtime changes in selected parameters. This gets rid of the need for an initial 'select pg_client_encoding()' query in libpq, bringing us back to one message transmitted in each direction for a standard connection startup. To allow server version to be sent using the same GUC mechanism that handles other parameters, invent the concept of a never-settable GUC parameter: you can 'show server_version' but it's not settable by any GUC input source. Create 'lc_collate' and 'lc_ctype' never-settable parameters so that people can find out these settings without need for pg_controldata. (These side ideas were all discussed some time ago in pgsql-hackers, but not yet implemented.)

COPY OUT reimplemented per new protocol: it doesn't need BACKSLASH. anymore, thank goodness. COPY BINARY to/from frontend works, at least as far as the backend is concerned --- libpq's PQgetline API is not up to snuff, and will have to be replaced with something that is null-safe. libpq uses message length words for performance improvement (no cycles wasted rescanning long messages), but not yet for error recovery.

Document.document: Clarify description of our deviation from standard for temp tables, per suggestion from Mike Sykes.

Document.document: Put the isync where it's supposed to be.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: When a TIMESTAMP, TIME, or INTERVAL precision is specified larger than our implementation limits, do not issue an ERRORSEMICOLON instead issue a NOTICE and use the max supported value. Per pgsql-general discussion of 28-Apr, this is needed to allow easy porting from pre-7.3 releases where the limits were higher. Unrelated change in same area: accept GLOBAL TEMP/TEMPORARY as a synonym for TEMPORARY, as per pgsql-hackers discussion of 15-Apr. We previously rejected it, but that was based on a misreading of the spec --- SQL92's GLOBAL temp tables are really closer to what we have than their LOCAL ones.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Applied patches from Kris Jurka fixing a string tokenizing problem and fixing an order by problem for index metadata results. Also includes removing some unused code as well as a fix to the toString method on statement. Modified Files: jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc1/AbstractJdbc1DatabaseMetaData.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc1/AbstractJdbc1Statement.java

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Bring SQL ref pages to consistent format, part 1.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Mark TimeScales constants as double to avoid integer overflow in some compilers.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove unnecessary dt2local() call.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix markup.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tighten up register usage for inline PPC version of tas().

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Infrastructure for deducing Param types from context, in the same way that the types of untyped string-literal constants are deduced (ie, when coerce_type is applied to 'em, that's what the type must be). Remove the ancient hack of storing the input Param-types array as a global variable, and put the info into ParseState instead. This touches a lot of files because of adjustment of routine parameter lists, but it's really not a large patch. Note: PREPARE statement still insists on exact specification of parameter types, but that could easily be relaxed now, if we wanted to do so.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Use closesocket() for all socket/pipe closing, because Win32 requires it, and map that to close() on Unix.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Infrastructure for upgraded error reporting mechanism. elog.c is rewritten and the protocol is changed, but most elog calls are still elog calls. Also, we need to contemplate mechanisms for controlling all this functionality --- eg, how much stuff should appear in the postmaster log? And what API should libpq expose for it?

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add more documentation about shared memory costs.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Change names of ISO-8859-x encodings to ISO_8859_x, to match reality.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some signed-vs-unsigned-int issuesSEMICOLON make print_aligned_vertical safe for zero-column tables.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out second part of patch.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Code review for holdable-cursors patch. Fix error recovery, memory context sloppiness, some other things. Includes Neil's mopup patch of 22-Apr.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Prevent palloc(0) error when parent table has zero columns.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Prevent palloc(0) error when parent table has zero columns.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Second round of FE/BE protocol changes. Frontend->backend messages now have length counts, and COPY IN data is packetized into messages.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Handle cp, rm, and exec for Win32.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Department of second thoughts: probably still need an IsTransactionState test in there...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak stats collector start logic so that we will not try to spawn a new stats collector oftener than once a minute. Per gripe from Erik Walthinsen 4/25/03.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Win32 shmem/sema prototypes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix misbehavior of func_error() on type names containing '%'. Will patch separately but equivalently in HEAD.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix misbehavior of replace() on strings containing '%'. Will patch separately but equivalently in HEAD.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update Japanese FAQ, from Jun Kuwamura.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Document file name as optional for BACKSLASHo in psql help (BACKSLASHh).

Document.author: davec
Document.document: added addDataType to the interface

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Generate pg_config.h.in by autoheader. Separate out manually editable parts. Standardize spelling of comments in pg_config.h.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix compile problem with Win32 macro used inside another macro.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Win32 path handling for / vs. BACKSLASH and drive letters.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Allow 60 in seconds fields of timestamp, time, interval input values. Per recent discussion on pgsql-general, this is appropriate for spec compliance, and has the nice side-effect of easing porting from old pg_dump files that exhibit the 59.999=>60.000 roundoff problem.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Allow 60 in seconds fields of timestamp, time, interval input values. Per recent discussion on pgsql-general, this is appropriate for spec compliance, and has the nice side-effect of easing porting from old pg_dump files that exhibit the 59.999=>60.000 roundoff problem.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair permissions problem in RI triggers: query parsing has to be done as the correct user, not only query execution. Per report from Sean Chittenden.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair permissions problem in RI triggers: query parsing has to be done as the correct user, not only query execution. Per report from Sean Chittenden.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix breakage from recent variable-handling changes.

Document.document: Clarify exactly when DST-changeover-induced regression test failures can be expected to occur.

Document.document: Remove Win32 special rename/unlink from libpq.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow BACKSLASHr and BACKSLASHrBACKSLASHn termination for COPY files. Output BACKSLASHrBACKSLASHn termination on Win32. Disallow literal carriage return as a data value, backslash-carriage-return and BACKSLASHr still allowed. Doc changes already committed.

Subject: Re: [HACKERS] [BUGS] Bug #943: Server-Encoding from EUC_TW to UTF-8 doesn't From: Tatsuo Ishii <t-ishii@sra.co.jp> To: michael.enke@wincor-nixdorf.com, pgsql-bugs@postgresql.org Cc: pgsql-hackers@postgresql.org Date: Sat, 12 Apr 2003 10:51:45 +0900 (JST)

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Avoid primary key lookup (and lock) if foreign key does not change on UPDATE. This get's rid of the long standing annoyance that updating a row that has foreign keys locks all the referenced rows even if the foreign key values do not change. The trick is to actually do a check identical to NO ACTION after an eventually done UPDATE in the SET DEFAULT case. Since a SET DEFAULT operation should have moved referencing rows to a new "home", a following NO ACTION check can only fail if the column defaults of the referencing table resulted in the key we actually deleted. Thanks to Stephan. Jan

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix erroneous space calculation leading to core dump in dumpProcLangs, per report from Olivier Prenant. Also fix off-by-one space calculation in ReadTocSEMICOLON this woould not have hurt us until we had more than 100 dependencies for a single object, but wrong is wrong.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix erroneous space calculation leading to core dump in dumpProcLangs, per report from Olivier Prenant. Also fix off-by-one space calculation in ReadTocSEMICOLON this woould not have hurt us until we had more than 100 dependencies for a single object, but wrong is wrong.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out last commit --- wrong patch.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up some problems in SetClientEncoding: failed to honor doit flag in all cases, leaked TopMemoryContext memory in others. Make the interaction between SetClientEncoding and InitializeClientEncoding cleaner and better documented. I suspect these changes should be back-patched into 7.3, but will wait on Tatsuo's verification.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add transaction status field to ReadyForQuery messages, and make room for tableID/columnID in RowDescription. (The latter isn't really implemented yet though --- the backend always sends zeroes, and libpq just throws away the data.)

Document.document: Patch to fix up LONGVARBINARY support submitted by Amit Gollapudi (agollapudi@demandsolutions.com). Also applied the RefCursor support patch by Nic Ferrier. This patch allows you too return a get a result set from a function that returns a refcursor. Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair sloppiness about where cached mergeclause pathkeys are allocated. Without this fix, CVS tip dumps core when running the regression tests with geqo_threshold = 2. I would think that a similar patch might be needed in 7.3, but cannot duplicate the failure in that branch --- so for now, leave well enough alone.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add PQunescapeBytea() and PQfeeMem() to the Win32 DLL list. Karl Waclawek

Document.document: Integrate the operator class section into the comprehensive extending SQL chapter as well.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove extraneous semicolons.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed double definition of ecpg_compat_mode.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Put back encoding-conversion step in processing of incoming queriesSEMICOLON I had inadvertently omitted it while rearranging things to support length-counted incoming messages. Also, change the parser's API back to accepting a 'char *' query string instead of 'StringInfo', as the latter wasn't buying us anything except overhead. (I think when I put it in I had some notion of making the parser API 8-bit-clean, but seeing that flex depends on null-terminated input, that's not really ever gonna happen.)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Various clarificationsSEMICOLON add a clear DRAFT markerSEMICOLON minor adjustments in some message types. In particular add text/binary flag to StartCopyIn and StartCopyOut, so that client library can know what is expected or forthcoming.

Document.document: Okay, I've had it with PQsetdbLogin having slightly different defaults than PQconnectdb. Reimplement the former to use the same code as the latter. Fix documentation omissions while at it.

Document.document: Add mention of Novell Netware 6 port.

Document.document: stddev() and variance() should return NULL when there is just one input value, per recent discussion on pgsql-general.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: First phase of work on array improvements. ARRAY[x,y,z] constructor expressions, ARRAY(sub-SELECT) expressions, some array functions. Polymorphic functions using ANYARRAY/ANYELEMENT argument and return types. Some regression tests in place, documentation is lacking. Joe Conway, with some kibitzing from Tom Lane.

Move the information on how to call table functions into the queries chapter. Remove some outdated information that is already present in a better form in other parts of the documentation.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove premature attempt to constant-fold type coercion expressions. While usually safe, this fails if the coercion function needs the query snapshot to be set already. Per example from Nigel Andrews.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adjust subquery qual pushdown rules so that we can push down a qual into a UNION that has some type coercions applied to the component queries, so long as the qual itself does not reference any columns that have such coercions. Per example from Jonathan Bartlett 24-Apr-03.

Document.document: Apple's assembler likes the inlined TAS syntax too, so no reason to maintain a separate out-of-line version of PPC tas() anymore. Also fix S_UNLOCK for __powerpc64__ platforms.

Document.document: Fix plpgsql so that variables of composite types (rowtypes) can be declared without having to write %ROWTYPE. If the declared type of a variable is a composite type, it'll be taken to be a row variable automatically.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: First phase of FE/BE protocol modifications: new StartupPacket layout with variable-width fields. No more truncation of long user names. Also, libpq can now send its environment-variable-driven SET commands as part of the startup packet, saving round trips to server.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix abstime-to-time cast function, which has had broken implementation since 7.2, per bug #947. Turns out it had wrong volatility label, too. Can't force initdb in 7.3 branch, but fix anyway for future installs.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix abstime-to-time cast function, which has had broken implementation since 7.2, per bug #947. Turns out it had wrong volatility label, too. Can't force initdb in 7.3 branch, but fix anyway for future installs.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix stupid oversight ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix stupid oversight ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Reorganize clog's error reporting so that PANIC on clog I/O error can be reduced to a plain ERROR. Should make it at least a little less painful to deal with data-corruption problems.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update to describe new set of globally-known contexts planned for support of extended query features in new FE/BE protocol. TransactionCommandContext is gone (PortalContext replaces it for some purposes), and QueryContext has taken on a new meaning (MessageContext plays its old role).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Missed some corner cases (PGSERVICE mostly)...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make getaddrinfo's behavior with NULL node parameter agree with the Linux man page for it. This error was preventing CVS tip from accepting remote connections.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some problems exposed by building outside the source tree.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: SECOND ATTEMPT Dump/read non-default GUC values for use by exec'ed backend, for Win32.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Dump/read non-default GUC values for use by exec'ed backends, for Win32.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Portal and memory management infrastructure for extended query protocol. Both plannable queries and utility commands are now always executed within Portals, which have been revamped so that they can handle the load (they used to be good only for single SELECT queries). Restructure code to push command-completion-tag selection logic out of postgres.c, so that it won't have to be duplicated between simple and extended queries. initdb forced due to addition of a field to Query nodes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: getaddrinfo has no business doing unlink().

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Avoid O(N^2) behavior with lots of deferred triggers by making deferredTriggerInvokeEvents only scan events added since it last ran. Stephan Szabo, some corrections by Tom Lane.
